content: 1. A satisfactory understanding of magnetic phenomenon in terms of moving charges/currents was arrived at after 1800 AD. But technological exploitation of the directional properties of magnets predates this scientific understanding by two thousand years. Thus, scientific understanding is not a necessary condition for engineering applications. Ideally, science and engineering go hand-in-hand, one leading and assisting the other in tandem.
summary: A concise 1-sentence summary of the text.
hypothetical_questions: What was the relationship between scientific understanding and technological application in the context of magnetic phenomenon?
How do we define science and engineering?
Is scientific understanding a necessary condition for engineering applications?
